quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Following and South Dakota
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, nicknames, deity. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: According to Roman myths, Cuba was the goddess of which of these?
What two states were admitted to the Union in 1959?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hawaii, Alaska

questions.question: Which of these nicknames refers to the U.S. state of South Dakota?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sunshine State

questions.question: What is the state animal of the U.S. state of South Dakota?
Portunes was a Roman deity who was regarded as the protector of which of the following?
The 1950s began with active US involvement in a major military conflict in Korea following which of these events?

options.text: The Soviet Union attempted to occupy Korea.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: North Korea attacked South Korea.

questions.question: What is the state sport of the U.S. state of South Dakota?
What is the tallest mountain in North America?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mount McKinley

questions.question: What material did goddess Cura use to create humans according to Roman mythology?
Brown vs. Board of Education, a landmark Supreme Court decision in 1954, ruled which of the following?

options.text: that states could not pass laws making homosexuality illegal
that arrested people had to be advised of their rights
that the military draft was legal
that segregation of schools was unconstitutional

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: that segregation of schools was unconstitutional

questions.question: In which U.S. state is the city called Pearl located?
What is the name of the capital city of the U.S. state of South Dakota?
The Roman goddess Vesta was considered the protector of which of the following?
In Roman mythology, the god Volturnus was associated with which of the following?
The U.S. state of South Dakota was named after which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Indigenous tribe

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Mountain and News
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, scaling, drama. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This 2009 sports drama movie, starring Sandra Bullock, is based on the true life story of a great offensive tackle.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Blind Side

questions.question: What did David Hempleman-Adams do in 1998?

options.text: He became the first person to ski Mount Everest.
He became the first person to climb the highest mountain on each of the seven continents.
He became the first person to climb the three tallest mountains in the world.
He became the first blind person to climb Mt. Everest.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He became the first person to climb the highest mountain on each of the seven continents.

questions.question: When an American soldier dies in combat, another soldier must deliver the news to the fallen soldiers family. In this 2009 movie, Sergeant Will Montgomery finds he has feelings for the woman to whom he has delivered news of her husband’s death.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Messenger

questions.question: The largest mountain on earth was scaled before 1585.
This great Italian poet wrote the oldest, existing record of a mountain climb.
Mount  Washington in New  Hampshire, is the highest mountain in the Northeastern USA. It is known for its very high winds and bad weather. When was it first climbed?
How many mountains on Earth are at least 8000 meters above sea level?
Spike Jonze directed this kids movie based on a Maurice Sendak book.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Where the Wild Things Are

questions.question: The first mountain scaling to be recorded was done by this Roman Emperor.
In 1975 Tabei Junko became the first woman to climb Everest. Where was she born?
Which mountain is the highest in the Andes?
Matt Damon reunites with Eddie Jemison in this 2009 movie about a government attempt to get evidence against an agri-business giant.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Informant

questions.question: The first family to have two members climb Mount Everest has this last name.
Which is the second highest mountain in terms of above sea level elevation?
What is the tallest mountain in the North American Rockies?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grand Teton

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Movie and Man
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, shimit, mandelas. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In this movie, Jean Craddock (Maggie Gyllenhaal) falls in love with a broken down musician (Jeff Bridges).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crazy Heart

questions.question: A man foolishly lets his brother overstay his welcome in his home. His wife leaves him as a result. That is the basic plot of this 2009 Coen Brothers film.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Serious Man

questions.question: If the Antarctic ice sheet were to melt, by how much would sea levels rise?

Joseph  Gordon-Levitt and  Zooey Deschanel star in this romantic movie about a young man falling for a woman who does not believe in true love.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: (500) Days of Summer

questions.question: The plot of this 2009 movie involves a young man trying to aide his sister-in-law when his brother is MIA in Afghanistan.
This 2009 Bollywood film tells the story of a poor barber who had helped his childhood friend become a great Bollywood film star.
Name the 2009 documentary in which Nobel Prize winners tell how they would help the world.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One Peace at a Time

questions.question: MoNique and Gabourey Sidibe star in this 2009 movie.
This 2009 film deals with Nelson Mandelas use of an integrated South African rugby team to help unify his nation.
The plot of this 2009 movies involves a gay man trying to cope with life without his life partner, who recently died.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Single Man

questions.question: Name the 2009 movie that features Don Cheadle, Richard Gere, Wesley Snipes, Ethan Hawke, Vincent DiOnofrio, Will Patton, Ellen Barkin and Lilie Taylor.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brooklyns Finest

questions.question: In this movie,  Lt. Aldo Raine (Brad Pitt) recruits a group of Jewish-American soldiers and tells them that they each owe him a hundred Nazi scalps.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Inglourious Basterds

questions.question: A ring of French kidnappers take Bryan Mills (Liam Neesons) daughter, Kim (Mary Grace) in this 2009 movie.
The moral of this 2009 film, directed by Shimit Amin, is: Honesty will eventually win.

options.text: Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Jewelry and Time
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, making, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these were brought back into fashion during the rule of Napoleon Bonaparte as the Emperor of the French?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cameo jewelry

questions.question: Which was the earliest Asian culture to produce jewelry, approximately 5,000 years ago?
In the Byzantine Empire, jewelry was crafted with an emphasis on which of the following?

This was the first major art movement of the 20th century. It featured wild, brush strokes, abstract and distorted images from nature, painted in unnatural colors. Matisse and Braque were involved in this movement for a short amount of time.
The seeds of this woody climbing vine or shrub yield a glycoside which can be toxic in large quantities. TV viewers may like this lane, but not its seed.
What does the diet of sparrows mainly consist of?
What was the most precious metal for the people of the Americas in ancient times?
Why was April 24, 1915 a terrible day in world history and a terrible day for all humanity?

options.text: It was the beginning of World War One.
It was the day James Garfield was assassinated.
It was the day when 250 Armenian intellectuals and leaders were slaughtered.
It was the beginning of the Great Depression.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It was the day when 250 Armenian intellectuals and leaders were slaughtered.

questions.question: What material was most highly prized in Ancient Egypt and was used most often for the making of jewelry?
True sparrows, belonging to the genus Passer, are native to which continent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which play by William Shakespeare contains a quote from the New Testament concerning the fall of a sparrow?
What was the aim of the Great sparrow campaign carried out between 1958 and 1962 in China?

options.text: To destroy the sparrow population in the country
To preserve the sparrows and increase their population
To teach people how to take care of injured sparrows
To import new sparrow species in the country

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To destroy the sparrow population in the country

questions.question: In classical chamber music, these four instruments make up a string quartet.

options.text: Two violins, a viola and a cello
A violin, a viola, a cello, and a double bass

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Two violins, a viola and a cello

questions.question: Which of these shapes predominated in the jewelry of Ancient Mesopotamia?
In what country were diamonds mined for the first time in human history?

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Gwyneth Paltrow and Daughter
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, actor, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Gwyneth Paltrow is known for practicing which of the following?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blythe Danner

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michelle Pfeiffer

questions.question: Nicolas Cage won a Best Actor Academy Award for his work in Leaving Las Vegas.
What 80s rocker appears in the moving and thought provoking 2000 drama, Pay It Forward?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jon Bon Jovi

questions.question: In what country was actress Gwyneth Paltrow born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: United States

questions.question: What names did Gwyneth Paltrow give to her daughter and son?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Apple and Moses

questions.question: To which Hollywood actor was Gwyneth Paltrow engaged in the mid 1990s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brad Pitt

questions.question: Gwyneth Paltrow was roommates and very close friends with which famous Hollywood actress?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Winona Ryder

questions.question: In the highly successful 1999 drama American Beauty, what was the name of the middle-aged character going through a midlife crisis that was portrayed by Kevin Spacey?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lester Burnham

questions.question: For her outstanding performance in which movie did Gwyneth Paltrow win an Academy Award?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shakespeare in Love

questions.question: Gwyneth Paltrow earned the criticism of scientists for claiming this product causes cancer.
Of what descent was Gwyneth Paltrows father?
What is the title of the popular story by Daphne du Maurier, in which sparrows are depicted as aggressive bloodthirsty attackers?
What three well-known TV hotties made appearances in the hilarious film, Old School?

options.text: Evangeline Lilly, Courtney Cox  Sofia Vergara
Kate Walsh, Jenna Fischer  Kaley Cuoco
Ellen Pompeo, Elisha Cuthbert  Leah Remini
Hayden Panettiere, Kristen Bell  Emily VanCamp

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Adolf Hitler and Parents
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, adopt, cuckoos. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Is it true that in the 2009 thriller Nine Dead, starring Melissa Joan Hart, the nine seemingly unconnected strangers are abducted and brought together in a room to help solve a brutal murder.
Which member of Adolf Hitler’s family was accustomed to whipping him severely as a punishment?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His father

questions.question: It Happened One Night, One Flew Over the Cuckoos Nest, and The Silence of the Lambs are the first three movies to win all five major Academy Awards (Best Picture, Best Actor, Best Actress, Director, and Screenplay).
In what way did Adolf Hitler commit suicide?

options.text: He shot himself in the head.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He shot himself in the head.

questions.question: In what religion was Adolf Hitler raised by his parents?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roman Catholicism

questions.question: Which of these is true about Adolf Hitler’s dietary habits?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was a vegetarian.

questions.question: In the 2009 disaster film, 2012, what ancient civilization predicted that the world would come to an end in the year 2012?
What interesting nickname did Adolf Hitler adopt in the early 1920s?
In the classic 80s film, Sixteen Candles, what was the name of the hilarious Asian foreign exchange student, portrayed by Gedde Watanabe?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Long Duk Dong

questions.question: Why did Adolf Hitler fail at high school, and had to repeat sixth grade?

options.text: He failed because of a long illness.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He did it on purpose.

questions.question: Adolf Hitler did not like women who wore which of the following?
Rumor has it that Adolf Hitler had one-quarter of what heritage?
Starring Humphrey Bogart and Lauren Bacall, the 1944 film, To Have and Have Not, was loosely based upon what American authors novel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ernest Hemingway

questions.question: Who directed the 1960 Best Picture winner, The Apartment, starring Jack Lemmon and Shirley MacLaine, as a follow-up to Some Like It Hot?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Billy Wilder

questions.question: In the 2007 smash comedy Superbad, what fictitious single name appears on Fogells fake ID?
